name: Glossary
body:
glossary ======== A glossary of 79 data management terms. IOOS is a veritable alphabet soup of acronyms and terms that are like-yet-not-like normal language, in another word, jargon. This is an attempt to make some sense of it for a relative newcomer. Some (most?) of these terms are in [IOOS Acronym List](http://www.ioos.noaa.gov/about/acronym_list.html). ## [A](#A) [B](#B) [C](#C) [D](#D) [E](#E) [F](#F) [G](#G) [H](#H) [I](#I) [J](#J) [K](#K) [L](#L) [M](#M) [N](#N) [O](#O) [P](#P) [Q](#Q) [R](#R) [S](#S) [T](#T) [U](#U) [V](#V) [W](#W) [X](#X) [Y](#Y) [Z](#Z)
A
ACDD
Attribute Convention for Data Discovery (was UDDC)
ArcGIS
A geographic information system (GIS) product from Esri.
B
C
Cartopy
A library providing cartographic tools for Python. A part of Scitools.
CBIBS
Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoy System
CDF
Common Data Format (CDF). Self-describing data format for the storage of scalar and multidimensional data in a platform- and discipline-independent way.
CDIP
Coastal Data Information Program
CDL
Common Data Language (Unidata). Text notation for netCDF objects and data.
CF
Climate and Forecast (CF)
COMT
Coastal and Ocean Modeling Testbed
COOL
Coastal Ocean Observation Lab (Rutgers University)
CoRTAD
Coral Reef Temperature Anomaly Database (NODC/CoRTAD)
CSV
Comma Separated Values (sometimes CSV/TSV)
CSW
Catalog Services for the Web. Service provided by OGC.
D
DMAC
Data Management and Communications
DODS
Distributed Oceanographic Data Systems. DODS is a framework for data providers to share data with each other and with end users.
DSG
Data Systems Group, part of GSD Information and Technology Services
E
EMMA
Enterprise Metadata Management Architecture
ERDDAP
Environmental Research Division's Data Access Program
Esri
Environmental Systems Research Institute, Inc. Environmental research company, developers of ArcGIS
ESRL
Earth System Research Laboratory
F
G
GeoJSON
GeoJSON is a JSON format for encoding a variety of geographic data structures. GeoJSON Specification
GrADS
The Grid Analysis and Display System (GrADS) is an interactive desktop tool that is used for easy access, manipulation, and visualization of earth science data.
GRIB
GRIB (GRIdded Binary or General Regularly-distributed Information in Binary form[1]) is a concise data format commonly used in meteorology to store historical and forecast weather data.
GSD
Global Systems Division (ESRL)
GTS
The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) Global Telecommunications System (GTS) disseminates data in near-real-time to operational weather and ocean forecasting centers.
H
HDF
Hierarchical Data Format version 4
HDF4
Hierarchical Data Format version 4, also known as HDF
HDF5
Hierarchical Data Format version 5
I
IOOS
Integrated Ocean Observing System
IRIS
Incorporated Research Institutions for Seismology
Iris
Iris is a Python library for Meteorology and Climatology, a part of Scitools.
ISO
THREDDS service that provides an ISO 19115 metadata representation of data and metadata structure. Packaged with ncISO.
J
JSON
JavaScript Object Notation
K
L
M
MMI
Marine Metadata Interoperability.
N
NCAR
National Center for Atmospheric Research
NCEP
National Centers for Environmental Prediction
ncISO
Package of metadata services from NOAA/NGDC that provides NCML, ISO, and UDDC services.
NcML
NcML is an XML representation of netCDF metadata.
NCML
THREDDS service provided by ncISO package that provides NcML representation and adds geospatial extent information if it has not already been documented.
ncSOS
NcSOS adds a OGC SOS service to your existing THREDDS server.
ncWMS
Web Map Service for geospatial data that are stored in CF-compliant NetCDF files
netCDF
Network Common Data Form
netCDF4
Version 4 of netCDF. Introduced the use of HDF5 as a storage layer into netCDF3, which allows use of groups, user-defined types, multiple unlimited dimensions, compression, data chunking, parallel I/O, and other features.
NGDC
National Geophysical Data Center (NOAA/NGDC)
NOAA
National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
NODC
National Oceanographic Data Center
NOSC
NOAA Observing Systems Council
NRT
Near Real Time
NWS
National Weather Service
O
OGC
Open Geospatial Consortium, Inc. (OGC)
OOI
Ocean Observatories Initiative
OPeNDAP
Open-source Project for a Network Data Access Protocol. OPeNDAP is both the name of a non-profit organization and the commonly-used name of a protocol which the OpeNDAP organization has developed.
ORR
Ontology Registry and Repository of MMI
OSC
Observing Systems Committee (OSC), a subcommittee of the NOAA Observing Systems Council (NOSC)
P
PyDAP
Pydap is a pure Python library implementing the Data Access Protocol, also known as DODS or OPeNDAP.
Q
QARTOD
Quality Assurance of Real-Time Ocean Data
QC
Quality Control
R
REST
Representational state transfer (REST) is an abstraction of the architecture of the World Wide Web; more precisely, REST is an architectural style consisting of a coordinated set of architectural constraints applied to components, connectors, and data elements, within a distributed hypermedia system.
RESTful
A descriptor or link that conforms with REST concept.
S
Scitools
Scitools comprises Iris and Cartopy, open source Python libraries initially created by the UK Met Office to enable the visualisation of weather and climate data.
SEED
Standard for the Exchange of Earthquake Data
SOS
Sensor Observation Service
SURA
Southeastern Universities Research Association
T
TableDAP
Tabledap lets you use the OPeNDAP constraint/selection protocol to request data subsets, graphs, and maps from tabular datasets (for example, buoy data).
TDS
THREDDS Data Server
THREDDS
Thematic Realtime Environmental Distributed Data Services
TPIO
NOAA Technology, Planning and Integration for Observation program
TSV
Tab Separated Values (CSV/TSV)
U
UAF
Unified Access Framework
UCAR
University Corporation for Atmospheric Research
UDDC
Unidata Data Discovery Convention? Former acronym for ACDD. A metadata rubric service provided by the THREDDS server extension library.
URI
uniform resource identifier (comprises a URL and/or a URN).
URL
uniform resource locator
URN
uniform resource name
V
vocabulary
This is a computer science term, not grammar. The same yet subtly different. From IOOS Vocabularies README, "Controlled vocabularies clarify the meaning of common concepts and enable more interoperable data systems through more precise definitions and machine readable online references."
W
WCS
Web Coverage Service - The Open Geospatial Consortium Web Coverage Service Interface Standard (WCS) defines Web-based retrieval of coverages that is, digital geospatial information representing space/time-varying phenomena.
WIS
WMO Information System (WIS), the next generation of World Meteorological Organization (WMO) Global Telecommunications System (GTS), disseminates data in near-real-time to operational weather and ocean forecasting centers.
WMO
World Meteorological Organization
WSDD
Web Service Description Document
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
